data.name: Celebi V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Line Force
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Roselia
data.flavorText: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

data.name: Roselia
data.flavorText: Its flowers give off a relaxing fragrance. The stronger its aroma, the healthier the Roselia is.

attacks.name: Absorb
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cottonee
data.flavorText: It shoots cotton from its body to protect itself. If it gets caught up in hurricane-strength winds, it can get sent to the other side of the Earth.

data.name: Roserade
data.flavorText: After captivating opponents with its sweet scent, it lashes them with its thorny whips.

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is also Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Whimsicott
data.flavorText: It scatters cotton all over the place as a prank. If it gets wet, it'll become too heavy to move and have no choice but to answer for its mischief.

attacks.name: Cotton Ride
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent shuffles their Active Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck.

data.name: Durant
data.flavorText: They lay their eggs deep inside their nests. When attacked by Heatmor, they retaliate using their massive mandibles.

attacks.name: Bite Together
attacks.text: If Durant is on your Bench, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Maractus
data.flavorText: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.

attacks.name: Powerful Needles
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Grookey
data.flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

data.name: Dhelmise V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Anchor Anger
attacks.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer.

data.name: Grookey
data.flavorText: When it uses its special stick to strike up a beat, the sound waves produced carry revitalizing energy to the plants and flowers in the area.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Thwackey
data.flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Hit
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.

data.name: Rillaboom
data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

attacks.name: Drum Roll
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Drum Beating
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Drum Beating.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

data.name: Rillaboom
data.flavorText: By drumming, it taps into the power of its special tree stump. The roots of the stump follow its direction in battle.

abilities.name: Voltage Beat
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Grass Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Thwackey
data.flavorText: The faster a Thwackey can beat out a rhythm with its two sticks, the more respect it wins from its peers.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Blipbug
data.flavorText: A constant collector of information, this Pokémon is very smart. Very strong is what it isn't.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Dottler
data.flavorText: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

attacks.name: Reflect
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Orbeetle
data.flavorText: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.

abilities.name: Bug's Radar
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck and put them back in any order.

attacks.name: Brainwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Eldegoss
data.flavorText: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

attacks.name: Blessing of Fluff
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Grass Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Vulpix
data.flavorText: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.

data.name: Gossifleur
data.flavorText: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Ninetales
data.flavorText: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

data.name: Torkoal V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Pillar
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Steam Crush
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Heatmor
data.flavorText: There's a hole in its tail that allows it to draw in the air it needs to keep its fire burning. If the hole gets blocked, this Pokémon will fall ill.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit's poisonous gas.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Victini V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spreading Flames
attacks.text: Attach up to 3 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Turtonator
data.flavorText: Explosive substances coat the shell on its back. Enemies that dare attack it will be blown away by an immense detonation.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it's raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Raboot
data.flavorText: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

attacks.name: Flame Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: A warm-up of running around gets fire energy coursing through this Pokémon's body. Once that happens, it's ready to fight at full power.

data.name: Raboot
data.flavorText: Its thick and fluffy fur protects it from the cold and enables it to use hotter fire moves.

data.name: Cinderace
data.flavorText: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

abilities.name: Libero
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when this Pokémon moves from your Bench to the Active Spot, you may attach up to 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to it.

attacks.name: Flare Striker
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Cinderace
data.flavorText: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

attacks.name: Pyro Ball
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burning Kick
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Sizzlipede
data.flavorText: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

data.name: Cinderace
data.flavorText: It juggles a pebble with its feet, turning it into a burning soccer ball. Its shots strike opponents hard and leave them scorched.

attacks.name: Flame Cloak
attacks.text: Attach a Fire Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bright Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Sizzlipede
data.flavorText: It stores flammable gas in its body and uses it to generate heat. The yellow sections on its belly get particularly hot.

attacks.name: Relentless Flames
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Centiskorch
data.flavorText: When it heats up, its body temperature reaches about 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. It lashes its body like a whip and launches itself at enemies.

attacks.name: Hundred Foot Flames
attacks.text: For each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Shellder
data.flavorText: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Cloyster
data.flavorText: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.

attacks.name: Shell Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

attacks.name: Super Slice
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Krabby
data.flavorText: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.

attacks.name: Aqua Shower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

data.name: Kingler
data.flavorText: The large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.

attacks.name: Heavy Pincers
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Claw Rend
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Seaking
data.flavorText: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

attacks.name: Ripping Horn
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Goldeen
data.flavorText: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.

attacks.name: Aqua Wash
attacks.text: You may put 2 Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.name: Qwilfish
data.flavorText: The small spikes covering its body developed from scales. They inject a toxin that causes fainting.

abilities.name: Poison Point
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Lapras VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Surf
attacks.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ocean Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

data.name: Keldeo V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Sobble
data.flavorText: When scared, this Pokémon cries. Its tears pack the chemical punch of 100 onions, and attackers won't be able to resist weeping.

data.name: Mantine
data.flavorText: If it builds up enough speed swimming, it can jump out above the waves and glide for over 300 feet.

attacks.name: Water Reserve
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Water Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Drizzile
data.flavorText: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for a Trainer card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Drizzile
data.flavorText: A clever combatant, this Pokémon battles using water balloons created with moisture secreted from its palms.

data.name: Inteleon
data.flavorText: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

abilities.name: Shady Dealings
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Aqua Bullet
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Inteleon
data.flavorText: It has many hidden capabilities, such as fingertips that can shoot water and a membrane on its back that it can use to glide through the air.

attacks.name: Silent Shot
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Hydro Snipe
attacks.text: You may put an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon into their hand.

data.name: Chewtle
data.flavorText: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

data.name: Drednaw
data.flavorText: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

attacks.name: Vise Bite
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

attacks.name: Jaw Lock
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Frosmoth
data.flavorText: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

abilities.name: Ice Dance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Water Pokémon.

data.name: Cramorant
data.flavorText: It's so strong that it can knock out some opponents in a single hit, but it also may forget what it's battling midfight.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Snom
data.flavorText: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Raichu
data.flavorText: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

data.name: Chinchou
data.flavorText: Its antennae, which evolved from a fin, have both positive and negative charges flowing through them.

attacks.name: Luring Glow
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Joltik
data.flavorText: Joltik can be found clinging to other Pokémon. It's soaking up static electricity because it can't produce a charge on its own.

data.name: Lanturn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

attacks.name: Strobe Shock
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find any Energy cards there, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tapu Koko V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Thunderous Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Galvantula
data.flavorText: It launches electrified fur from its abdomen as its means of attack. Opponents hit by the fur could be in for three full days and nights of paralysis.

attacks.name: Volt Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Yamper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Yamper
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the base of its tail.

data.name: Boltund
data.flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

attacks.name: Big Bite
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Fighting Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V or Pokémon-GX, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Boltund
data.flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity and channels it into its legs to keep them going strong. Boltund can run nonstop for three full days.

attacks.name: Electrodash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Pincurchin
data.flavorText: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

attacks.name: Shocking Needles
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads. If at least 2 of them are heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Morpeko
data.flavorText: As it eats the seeds stored up in its pocket-like pouches, this Pokémon is not just satisfying its constant hunger. It's also generating electricity.

attacks.name: Attack the Wound
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 50 more damage.

data.name: Morpeko V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electro Wheel
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Ponyta
data.flavorText: This Pokémon will look into your eyes and read the contents of your heart. If it finds evil there, it promptly hides away.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Morpeko VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Discharge
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Galarian Rapidash
data.flavorText: Brave and prideful, this Pokémon dashes airily through the forest, its steps aided by the psychic power stored in the fur on its fetlocks.

abilities.name: Pastel Veil
abilities.text: Your Pokémon recover from all Special Conditions and can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Wobbuffet V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gritty Comeback
attacks.text: Switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar's doing.

abilities.name: Life Shaker
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Psychic Pokémon to another of your Psychic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Munna
data.flavorText: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it's eating a good dream, and black when it's eating a nightmare.

attacks.name: Moonlight
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Polteageist
data.flavorText: This species lives in antique teapots. Most pots are forgeries, but on rare occasions, an authentic work is found.

attacks.name: Teatime
attacks.text: Each player draws 2 cards.

attacks.name: Poltergeist
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. This attack does 50 damage for each Trainer card you find there.

data.name: Musharna
data.flavorText: It drowses and dreams all the time. It's best to leave it be if it's just woken up, as it's a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

attacks.name: Sleepy Pulse
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep. During Pokémon Checkup, your opponent flips 2 coins instead of 1. If either of them is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Super Hypnoblast
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Asleep, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Sinistea
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is said to have been born when a lonely spirit possessed a cold, leftover cup of tea.

attacks.name: Teatime
attacks.text: Each player draws 2 cards.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

attacks.name: Stomp Off
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Rhydon
data.flavorText: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Hitmonlee
data.flavorText: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

attacks.name: Coordinated Strike
attacks.text: If Hitmonchan is on your Bench, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Hitmonchan
data.flavorText: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

attacks.name: Coordinated Beatdown
attacks.text: If Hitmonlee is on your Bench, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Rhyhorn
data.flavorText: It can remember only one thing at a time. Once it starts rushing, it forgets why it started.

data.name: Rhyperior
data.flavorText: It relies on its carapace to deflect incoming attacks and throw its enemy off balance. As soon as that happens, it drives its drill into the foe.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Bedrock Shake
attacks.text: This attack also does 60 damage to each Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sudowoodo
data.flavorText: If a tree branch shakes when there is no wind, it's a Sudowoodo, not a tree. It hides from the rain.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

data.name: Claydol
data.flavorText: This mysterious Pokémon started life as an ancient clay figurine made over 20,000 years ago.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Explosion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 120 damage to itself.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It moves while spinning around on its single foot. Some Baltoy have been seen spinning on their heads.

data.name: Regirock V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rocky Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Mudbray
data.flavorText: Loads weighing up to 50 times as much as its own body weight pose no issue for this Pokémon. It's skilled at making use of mud.

data.name: Mudsdale
data.flavorText: Mud that hardens around a Mudsdale's legs sets harder than stone. It's so hard that it allows this Pokémon to scrap a truck with a single kick.

attacks.name: Double Impact
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 120 damage for each heads.

data.name: Silicobra
data.flavorText: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

data.name: Silicobra
data.flavorText: As it digs, it swallows sand and stores it in its neck pouch. The pouch can hold more than 17 pounds of sand.

data.name: Sandaconda
data.flavorText: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

attacks.name: Coil
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's attacks do 120 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Sandaconda
data.flavorText: When it contracts its body, over 220 pounds of sand sprays from its nose. If it ever runs out of sand, it becomes disheartened.

abilities.name: Sand Sac
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Press
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has at least 1 extra Fighting Energy attached (in addition to this attack's cost), this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: It's very curious, but its means of investigating things is to try to punch them with its tentacles. The search for food is what brings it onto land.

data.name: Stonjourner
data.flavorText: It stands in grasslands, watching the sun's descent from zenith to horizon. This Pokémon has a talent for delivering dynamic kicks.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Grapploct
data.flavorText: A body made up of nothing but muscle makes the grappling moves this Pokémon performs with its tentacles tremendously powerful.

attacks.name: Octolock
attacks.text: Until this Grapploct leaves the Active Spot, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost ColorlessColorless more, and the Defending Pokémon can't retreat. This effect can't be applied more than once.

attacks.name: Tough Swing
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

data.name: Stonjourner V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Galarian Zigzagoon
data.flavorText: Thought to be the oldest form of Zigzagoon, it moves in zigzags and wreaks havoc upon its surroundings.

abilities.name: Headbutt Tantrum
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Stonjourner VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stone Gift
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, heal 120 damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Linoone
data.flavorText: This very aggressive Pokémon will recklessly challenge opponents stronger than itself.

attacks.name: Night Slash
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Obstagoon
data.flavorText: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

abilities.name: Untamed Shout
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Obstruct
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Basic Pokémon.

data.name: Sableye V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lode Search
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Crazy Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Croagunk
data.flavorText: It makes frightening noises with its poison-filled cheek sacs. When opponents flinch, Croagunk hits them with a poison jab.

data.name: Toxicroak
data.flavorText: It bounces toward opponents and gouges them with poisonous claws. No more than a scratch is needed to knock out its adversaries.

abilities.name: More Poison
abilities.text: Put 2 more damage counters on your opponent's Poisoned Pokémon during Pokémon Checkup.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Skorupi
data.flavorText: It attacks using the claws on its tail. Once locked in its grip, its prey is unable to move as this Pokémon's poison seeps in.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Drapion
data.flavorText: It's so vicious that it's called the Sand Demon. Yet when confronted by Hippowdon, Drapion keeps a low profile and will never pick a fight.

attacks.name: Hard Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Strike
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Mawile
data.flavorText: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Ferrothorn
data.flavorText: This Pokémon scrapes its spikes across rocks, and then uses the tips of its feelers to absorb the nutrients it finds within the stone.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Energy Slap
attacks.text: You may move all Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Ferroseed
data.flavorText: It defends itself by launching spikes, but its aim isn't very good at first. Only after a lot of practice will it improve.

data.name: Nickit
data.flavorText: Aided by the soft pads on its feet, it silently raids the food stores of other Pokémon. It survives off its ill-gotten gains.

attacks.name: Instigate
attacks.text: Your opponent shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If they put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, they draw 3 cards.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

abilities.name: Steely Spirit
abilities.text: Your Metal Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Thievul
data.flavorText: It secretly marks potential targets with a scent. By following the scent, it stalks its targets and steals from them when they least expect it.

attacks.name: Thief
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. Choose a card you find there and put it on the bottom of their deck.

data.name: Galarian Meowth
data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

attacks.name: Hone Claws
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Slash attack does 60 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

data.name: Corviknight
data.flavorText: This Pokémon reigns supreme in the skies of the Galar region. The black luster of its steel body could drive terror into the heart of any foe.

attacks.name: Iron Wings
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, during your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 100 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Copperajah
data.flavorText: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

attacks.name: Dig Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Muscular Nose
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has 8 or more damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Cufant
data.flavorText: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

abilities.name: Primate Wisdom
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch a card from your hand with the top card of your deck.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

attacks.name: Charge Order
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pawniard.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.

data.name: Noctowl
data.flavorText: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

attacks.name: Carry Off
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. They shuffle that Pokémon and all attached cards into their deck. Then, shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

attacks.name: Glance
attacks.text: Look at the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Zamazenta V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dauntless Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX.

attacks.name: Assault Tackle
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Hoothoot
data.flavorText: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Cinccino
data.flavorText: Its body secretes oil that this Pokémon spreads over its nest as a coating to protect it from dust. Cinccino won't tolerate even a speck of the stuff.

abilities.name: Make Do
abilities.text: You must discard a card from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Energy Assist
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Minccino
data.flavorText: The way it brushes away grime with its tail can be helpful when cleaning. But its focus on spotlessness can make cleaning more of a hassle.

data.name: Wooloo
data.flavorText: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

data.name: Galarian Stunfisk
data.flavorText: Living in mud with a high iron content has given it a strong steel body.

abilities.name: Snap Trap
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if it is Knocked Out), discard an Energy from the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Damage Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Zacian V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Intrepid Sword
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards into your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Brave Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Snorlax V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Falling Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Snorlax VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Fall
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Rookidee
data.flavorText: It will bravely challenge any opponent, no matter how powerful. This Pokémon benefits from every battle—even a defeat increases its strength a bit.

data.name: Wooloo
data.flavorText: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

attacks.name: Expand
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 10 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Drampa
data.flavorText: The mountains it calls home are nearly two miles in height. On rare occasions, it descends to play with the children living in the towns below.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

data.name: Corvisquire
data.flavorText: Smart enough to use tools in battle, these Pokémon have been seen picking up rocks and flinging them or using ropes to wrap up enemies.

attacks.name: Pluck
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Dubwool
data.flavorText: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

attacks.name: Cotton Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Double-Edge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Cramorant V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Spit Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Air Balloon
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Big Charm
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Pokémon this card is attached to gets +30 HP.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Crushing Hammer
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Marnie
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Quick Ball
rules: You can play this card only if you discard another card from your hand.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Pal Pad
rules: Shuffle up to 2 Supporter cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Poké Kid
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Dhelmise V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Anchor Anger
attacks.text: If any of your Grass Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during their last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Giga Hammer
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Giga Hammer.

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Professor's Research (Professor Magnolia)
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rotom Bike
rules: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. Your turn ends.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Sitrus Berry
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
At the end of each turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to has 3 or more damage counters on it, heal 30 damage from it and discard this card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Team Yell Grunt
rules: Put an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon into their hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Evolution Incense
rules: Search your deck for an Evolution Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Hop
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lucky Egg
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, draw cards until you have 7 cards in your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Hyper Potion
rules: Heal 120 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has at least 2 Energy attached. If you healed any damage in this way, discard 2 Energy from it.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Lum Berry
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
At the end of each turn, if the Pokémon this card is attached to is affected by any Special Conditions, it recovers from all of them, and discard this card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ordinary Rod
rules:
Choose 1 or both:
• Shuffle up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.
• Shuffle up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Aurora Energy
rules: You can attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon only if you discard another card from your hand.
As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

data.name: Metal Saucer
rules: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Metal Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Pokégear 3.0
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Supporter card you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Pokémon Center Lady
rules: Heal 60 damage from 1 of your Pokémon, and it recovers from all Special Conditions.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Vitality Band
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 10 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Wobbuffet V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Gritty Comeback
attacks.text: Switch all damage counters on this Pokémon with those on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Sableye V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Lode Search
attacks.text: Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Crazy Claws
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Team Yell Grunt
rules: Put an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon into their hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Morpeko VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Discharge
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Snorlax VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Fall
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Zacian V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Intrepid Sword
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards into your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Brave Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Metal Saucer
rules: Attach a Metal Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Metal Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ordinary Rod
rules:
Choose 1 or both:
• Shuffle up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your deck.

You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Torkoal V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Combustion Pillar
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a Fire Energy card, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Steam Crush
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Morpeko V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electro Wheel
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Zacian V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Intrepid Sword
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 3 cards of your deck and attach any number of Metal Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards into your hand. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Brave Blade
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: G-Max Pump
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

attacks.name: Assault Tackle

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Surf
attacks.text: Attach a Water Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon. If you do, switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ocean Loop
attacks.text: Put 2 Water Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Indeedee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Watch Over
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 60 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Beak Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Spit Shot
attacks.text: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Marnie
rules: Each player shuffles their hand and puts it on the bottom of their deck. If either player put any cards on the bottom of their deck in this way, you draw 5 cards, and your opponent draws 4 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Team Yell Grunt
rules: Put an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon into their hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Zamazenta V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Dauntless Shield
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon VMAX.

attacks.name: Assault Tackle
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Snorlax V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Swallow
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Falling Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Stonjourner VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Stone Gift
attacks.text: Attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, heal 120 damage from that Pokémon.

data.name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Air Balloon
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Retreat Cost of the Pokémon this card is attached to is ColorlessColorless less.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Quick Ball
rules: You can play this card only if you discard another card from your hand.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
